DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft From Umbilical Cord Blood Or National Marrow Donor Program Legal Adult Tissue Donor Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the hematopoietic cell product (graft) was derived from a cord blood unit or NMDP adult donor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Graft From Umbilical Cord Blood Or National Marrow Donor Program Legal Adult Tissue Donor
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need._A person of legal age to consent to a procedure as specifed by local regulation._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredName: From Umbilical Cord Blood Or National Marrow Donor Program Legal Adult Donor
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.:A person of legal age to consent to a procedure as specifed by local regulation.:Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.

Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.
A person of legal age to consent to a procedure as specifed by local regulation.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.
